meanings.definition: A short, sharp sound made by small birds or insects.
meanings.sent1: The chirps of the birds woke me up in the morning.
meanings.sent2: I love listening to the chirps of crickets on a summer night.
meanings.sent3: The chirps of the tiny birds outside my window sounded like a morning alarm.
meanings.sent4: The chirps of the insects filled the air, creating a symphony of nature.
meanings.sent5: The chirps of the sparrows added a cheerful melody to the quiet garden.

meanings.definition: To make a series of high-pitched sounds.
meanings.sent1: The baby bird chirps for its mother to bring food.
meanings.sent2: The cricket chirps happily in the grass.
meanings.sent3: As the alarm clock rang, he chirps in annoyance at being woken up.
meanings.sent4: The old door chirps in protest as it swings open.
meanings.sent5: She chirps with excitement upon seeing her favorite singer perform live.
